items.title: X teams up with Visa to expand digital payments: sources
items.summary:
- X is collaborating with Visa to enhance digital payment systems.
- This partnership aims to broaden the reach of digital payments.
- Further details on the specifics of the collaboration were not disclosed.

items.title: Taiwan weighs support on chips amid US tariff proposal
items.summary:
- Taiwan is evaluating measures to support its semiconductor industry following US tariffs proposed by President Trump.
- Premier Cho Jung-tai stated that the government will review the necessity of cooperative plans or assistance programs.
- TSMC has significantly increased its US investments to $65 billion, up from a previous $12 billion.

items.title: Arm China names new CEO amid AI, geopolitical shifts
items.summary:
- Arm China appoints Chen Feng as new CEO.
- Appointment aims to address leadership challenges and adapt to technological and geopolitical changes.
- Follows resignation of interim co-CEOs Liu Renchen and Eric Chen after the ouster of former CEO Allen Wu in 2022.
- Arm China is pivotal in the US-China tech rivalry, as its chip designs power most smartphones, including Apple's iPhone.
- The US has imposed export curbs on advanced AI chips amid rising tensions, while China is wary of past trade policies.

items.title: Australian neurodivergent social app Spoony raises $1m
items.author: Nicholas Carlton, Kenneth Liang
items.summary:
- Australian startup Spoony raised US$1 million in pre-seed funding to grow its platform for disabled, neurodivergent, and chronically ill users.
- Funding was led by Antler Ventures, with contributions from Melba Support and Trampoline.
- Since its soft launch in September, it has attracted over 22,000 users and has a significant waitlist.
- Spoony addresses social isolation faced by neurodivergent individuals on mainstream platforms via a unique energy status display.
- Plans for revenue include partnerships with businesses, healthcare providers, and developing educational content and AI support.
- The startup aims to expand to the US, UK, and Canada to serve global neurodivergent and disabled communities.

items.title: Will big banks tank BNPL startups?
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Banks in Indonesia are rapidly expanding their buy now, pay later (BNPL) services, outpacing fintech startups such as Akulaku and Kredivo.
- Just six banks currently offer BNPL, yet they control 2.5 times the volume disbursed by fintechs.
- HSBC is shutting down its payments app Zing after just a year, risking about 400 jobs; this highlights the challenges large corporations face when incubating startups.

items.title: Charting Asia’s M&As: When do startups usually make an exit?
items.author: Elyssa Lopez, Queena Wadyanti, Yeo Cheng Yong, Timmy Loen, Collin Furtado, Jaclyn Tiu
items.summary:
- Many startups do not have a clear exit strategy, according to investors and founders.
- Exit strategies include mergers and acquisitions (M&As), initial public offerings, and liquidation.
- The article provides data to help founders and investors determine the best timing for exit through M&As in Asia.

items.title: White House evaluates national security risks of DeepSeek AI
items.author: Karoline Leavitt, David Sacks
items.summary:
- US officials are reviewing national security concerns about DeepSeek, an AI app developed in China.
- The National Security Council is leading the review due to potential impacts on US AI companies.
- Concerns include potential intellectual property theft and countermeasures by US AI firms.
- DeepSeek's affordable AI models have caused declines in global technology stocks, raising fears of competition with US leaders like OpenAI and Alphabet.
- The US Commerce Department has imposed restrictions on AI hardware exports to China.

items.title: UK monitors DeepSeek AI app’s impact on security and data
items.summary:
- The UK government is monitoring the impact of the DeepSeek AI app on national security.
- Prime Minister Keir Starmer's spokesperson emphasized the government's commitment to oversight of new technologies as of January 28.
- DeepSeek's app has quickly risen to the top of the US App Store following its recent launch.
- Strict regulations are in place regarding technology use on government devices in the UK.
- The UK has strong data protection laws applicable to all firms, with compliance penalties.

items.title: US-based AI startup revenue surges to $300m
items.author: Jonathan Siddharth
items.summary:
- Artificial intelligence data startup Turing's revenue tripled to US$300 million in 2024, achieving profitability.
- The firm, based in Palo Alto, was valued at US$1.1 billion in 2021 and serves high-profile clients including OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and Meta.
- Turing contracts over 4 million experts for data annotation to aid in model training, addressing data shortages in AI development.

items.title: China’s semiconductor firm breaks US export limits
Investment firms acquire $1b of Musk’s X debt
items.summary:
- Diameter Capital Partners and Darsana Capital Partners acquire $1 billion in debt related to Elon Musk’s acquisition of X.
- Loans were arranged by a Morgan Stanley-led consortium to gauge demand before a larger $3 billion debt offering.
- The move is part of efforts to offload portions of Musk’s $13 billion debt from the 2022 buyout, which has decreased in value to around 60 cents on the dollar.
- Other firms like PIMCO and Apollo Global Management are also interested in the additional debt package but no deals have been finalized.

items.title: AI startup nets $25m series A led by Khosla Ventures
items.summary:
- AI startup secures $25 million in Series A funding.
- The funding round is led by Khosla Ventures.
- The investment aims to enhance the startup's product development and market presence.

items.title: Google fights $4.5b EU fine over Android antitrust claims
items.summary:
- Google contested a €4.3 billion fine at the EU’s Court of Justice on Jan. 27, concerning anti-competitive practices related to Android.
- The fine, issued in 2018, accused Google of requiring pre-installation of Google Search and Chrome for app store access and limiting alternative Android versions.
- Google claims the Commission made errors in investigations, attributing Android's success to innovation.
- A final decision on the appeal is anticipated in the coming months.

items.title: Philips CEO warns EU rules threaten AI innovation
items.author: Roy Jakobs, Christian Klein, Pekka Lundmark
items.summary:
- Roy Jakobs, CEO of Royal Philips, warns EU regulations could stifle AI innovation.
- He spoke at the ICT & Health World Conference on January 28, emphasizing the risk of Europe falling behind in AI.
- Other industry leaders support delaying AI regulations to simplify the current framework for better competitiveness.

items.title: Pro-crypto Scott Bessent confirmed as US Treasury chief
items.summary:
- Scott Bessent confirmed as US Treasury Secretary on Jan. 27 with a 68-29 vote.
- Nominated by President Donald Trump, he succeeds Janet Yellen.
- A hedge fund manager, he is an advocate for cryptocurrency and opposes a US central bank digital currency.
- Will join the Presidential Working Group on Digital Asset Markets to focus on digital asset regulations.
- May propose a universal tariff on US imports ranging from 2.5% to 20%.

items.title: UK launches probe into AWS, Microsoft cloud market dominance
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- The UK government has initiated a probe into the cloud market, focusing on dominance by AWS and Microsoft.
- The investigation aims to assess competition concerns and potential market abuses.
- This move is part of a broader effort by regulators to ensure fair play in the technology sector.

items.title: ASML faces growth concerns amid DeepSeek, Trump export risks
items.summary:
- ASML will report Q4 earnings on January 31.
- Concerns arise over growth outlook for 2025 due to DeepSeek's AI model requiring less computing power.
- Uncertainty exists regarding potential US export restrictions on ASML's older DUV products to China.
- ASML projects 2025 sales of €30-35 billion driven by AI chip demand, but investors await confirmation through bookings.

items.title: Shares of Australian AI firms drop after DeepSeek’s launch
items.summary:
- Shares of Australian AI firms fell on Jan. 28 following the launch of DeepSeek's low-cost AI assistant.
- Appen’s stock dropped 3.3% and Brainchip saw a decline of 10.3%.
- The technology sub-index decreased by 1%.
- DeepSeek's AI assistant operates with lower data requirements and at a reduced cost.
- Australian data-center-related companies also faced declines: Goodman Group (-6.4%), NEXTDC (-6.2%), DigiCo Infrastructure REIT (-11.1%).
- Concerns about reduced spending on data infrastructure due to DeepSeek’s product surfaced.

items.title: 50 rising greentech startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists cleantech startups in Asia that have recently raised funding, indicating potential for growth.
- It includes companies up to the series E stage, with details about their funding rounds.
- The list is updated regularly and aims to track emerging startups in the greentech sector.

items.title: India-based gaming startup raises $1.2m for growth
items.author: Prince Thomas, Ranjit Kumar Behera, Ajith Sunny
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based gaming startup MetaShot raised 11 crore rupees (around US$1.2 million) through equity and debt financing.
- The funding round was led by Sauce VC, with contributions from Sharrp Ventures and Panthera Peak Capital.
- Founded in 2021, MetaShot plans to use the funds for team expansion, research and development, and growth strategies.
- The MetaShot smart bat, launched in August 2023, translates real-world cricket shots into game actions.
- The smart bat offers six hours of playtime, USB-C charging, and Bluetooth connectivity to mobile phones.

items.title: Delhivery shares hit 52-week low, recover slightly
items.summary:
- Delhivery shares hit a 52-week low of 306.50 rupees on Jan. 28 during intraday trading.
- Shares recovered to 317.45 rupees, marking a 1.21% increase.
- Market capitalization is now at 23,601.22 crore rupees with approximately 770,000 shares traded.
- This is the second consecutive session with a new 52-week low, despite closing the last three sessions negatively.
- Over the past month, stocks have declined by 8.38% and by 25.51% in the past year.

items.title: Arizona passes first US bill for public bitcoin Investment
items.author: Wendy Rogers, Jeff Weninger
items.summary:
- Arizona Senate Finance Committee approved the Arizona Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Act (SB 1025) with a 5-2 vote.
- The bill allows public funds to invest up to 10% in cryptocurrency.
- If passed, Arizona will be the first state to mandate public funds to hold bitcoin.
- The bill will proceed to the Senate Rules Committee for more discussion before heading to the House of Representatives.

items.title: Indian drone tech firm secures $21k contract with Indian Army
items.author: Prateek Srivastava
items.summary:
- DroneAcharya secures a contract worth approximately $21,598 with the Indian Army.
- Contract involves establishing a drone training lab and conducting flying lessons for army personnel.
- Agreement spans from Jan. 27, 2023, to March 28, 2025.
- Following this, DroneAcharya signed a term sheet with AVPL International for a potential merger.
- DroneAcharya was founded in 2017 and specializes in drone manufacturing and operations training.

items.title: SK hynix beats Samsung in quarterly profit for first time
items.summary:
- SK hynix reported an operating profit of 8.08 trillion won (US$5.62 billion) for Q4 2024, a 15% increase from last year.
- Samsung expects a lower operating profit of 6.5 trillion won (US$4.5 billion) for the same period.
- SK hynix's success is attributed to rising demand for AI memory chips, especially high bandwidth memory (HBM) chips.
- Samsung's slower rollout of HBM products may hinder its ability to capitalize on the AI demand.

items.title: Zomato appoints former executive to head dining out vertical
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Zomato has appointed Shalin Bhatt as the head of its dining-out vertical, replacing Sankalp Kathuria.
- Bhatt rejoined Zomato in July 2024 and is the third leader in this segment within two years.
- This leadership change is part of Zomato's strategy to promote its new District app for dining services.
- Zomato acquired Paytm’s events and ticketing business for ₹2,048 crore (US$236.54 million) in August 2024, boosting its going-out vertical.
- The company reported a threefold increase in revenue from the going-out division in Q3 2025 and has over 6.5 million downloads of the District app.

items.title: Microsoft focus on cloud growth with $80b AI investment
items.summary:
- Microsoft will announce its quarterly revenue forecast on Jan. 29, highlighting the impact of its $80 billion AI investments on Azure cloud growth.
- After two quarters of slower growth, Azure is expected to see a growth report of 31.8% in the second quarter, compared to 33% in the previous quarter.
- The company anticipates a rebound in growth due to its partnership with OpenAI.
- Microsoft continues to manage most of OpenAI's consumer and developer traffic, ensuring Azure's revenue despite competition.
- Overall, Microsoft’s intelligent cloud segment is expected to grow by 19.7%, with total revenue growth projected at 10.9% and net profit growth at 6.3%.

items.title: DeepSeek founder gains recognition in AI sector
items.author: Liang Wenfeng
items.summary:
- Liang Wenfeng, founder of DeepSeek, recognized by the Chinese government in the AI sector.
- DeepSeek, founded in 2023, has developed a low-cost AI model.
- The AI model contributed to a decline in the Nasdaq index recently.
- Liang leads a team of 139, smaller than major competitors like OpenAI.
- He attended a meeting with Premier Li Qiang on Jan. 27, aiming to make AI more accessible.

items.title: DeepSeek’s AI chatbot disrupts Southeast Asia’s data centers
items.summary:
- DeepSeek's entry into the AI market raises concerns about data center investments in Southeast Asia.
- The company’s free AI chatbot undercuts major competitors like OpenAI and Google’s Gemini.
- DeepSeek's launch has caused declines in US tech stocks, including Nvidia.
- Investors worry that DeepSeek's low-cost model will change AI development trends and lower data center demand.
- Analyst Adib Zalkapli states it’s early to predict impacts, but investors are reevaluating AI investments.

items.title: OpenAI requests Indian court to dismiss copyright lawsuit
items.summary:
- OpenAI has asked an Indian court to dismiss a copyright lawsuit from the Federation of Indian Publishers (FIP).
- FIP alleges OpenAI’s ChatGPT infringes copyright by generating summaries from unlicensed books.
- The lawsuit was initiated in December by FIP on behalf of publishers including Rupa Publications and Penguin Random House.
- OpenAI argues its practices fall under fair use as they utilize publicly available data.
- This lawsuit follows a November 2024 case where ANI accused OpenAI of improperly using its content for training.
- OpenAI mentioned that US laws complicate removal requests for training data amid ongoing litigation.

items.title: Retail investors surge into Nvidia amid stock dip
items.summary:
- Retail investors purchased US$562.2 million in Nvidia shares on January 27, the highest since 2014.
- This buying spree followed a 17% drop in Nvidia's stock, correlated with a US$593 billion decrease in market value due to competition from a new AI model by DeepSeek.
- Nvidia's stock decline is part of a larger trend affecting global technology stocks, amid concerns over valuations and competition.
- Despite a slight recovery on January 28, investor caution persists in the market.
- Overall, retail investors have invested around US$7.3 billion in Nvidia stocks in the last quarter, about half of the peak purchases from September 2024.

items.title: Trump plans tariffs on imported chips
items.summary:
- Former US President Donald Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on imported computer chips and semiconductors.
- The tariffs aim to bolster domestic production and will be implemented “in the near future.”
- Trump criticized the Biden administration’s CHIPS Act, calling the incentives “ridiculous.”
- He proposed higher tariffs, stating they should be “much bigger” than the current 2.5% rate without providing a specific figure.
- Reports suggest these tariffs could lead to increased consumer prices for technology products like laptops, tablets, and smartphones.
- The impact of these proposed tariffs on existing semiconductor facilities under the CHIPS Act remains uncertain, especially after over US$30 billion in private sector investments have been attracted.

items.title: Israel’s mobile game developer lays off amid ongoing growth
items.summary:
- A mobile game developer in Israel is reducing its workforce despite ongoing growth in the gaming industry.
- The layoffs are attributed to market adjustments and operational restructuring.
- The company aims to streamline its operations to maintain competitiveness in a rapidly evolving market.

items.title: DeepSeek pauses for Lunar New Year amid global buzz
items.summary:
- Chinese AI start-up DeepSeek has paused activities for the Lunar New Year holiday.
- The company gained global attention with its multimodal image generation model, Janus-Pro, released on Jan. 27, which surpassed DALL-E 3 and Stable Diffusion in benchmarks.
- Despite the holiday, company security noted increased interest, turning away uninvited guests, with discussions about its impact occurring in Silicon Valley and Wall Street.
- DeepSeek operates without a dedicated public relations team.

items.title: Israeli cybersecurity startup raises $20m series A
items.summary:
- An Israeli cybersecurity startup has successfully raised $20 million in a Series A funding round.
- The funding aims to enhance its cybersecurity solutions and expand its market reach.
- This investment marks a significant milestone for the startup and highlights growing interest in cybersecurity innovation.

items.title: Singapore fintech raises $10m to revolutionize trade finance
items.summary:
- 129Knots, a fintech startup in Singapore, has raised US$10 million in funding led by Sing Fuels.
- The company has a US$500 million pipeline and was incubated by the Singapore EDB’s Corporate Venture Launchpad program.
- Their proprietary OTD platform uses global data and machine learning via a credit engine called Tribal Knots to analyze buyer behavior and transaction patterns.
- Aiming to address a US$2.5 trillion global trade finance gap, they offer solutions like trade credit, asset tokenization, and blockchain audit trails.
- Initially targeting the marine energy transition sector with plans for expansion into other industries.

items.title: DeepSeek AI app sparks concerns over US data in China
items.summary:
- DeepSeek AI app raises concerns about US data security in China.
- Issues involve potential misuse of sensitive information and privacy violations.
- The context includes rising global scrutiny on AI applications and data governance.

items.title: The hidden alliances between Southeast Asia’s VCs, uncovered
Ex-Tech Mahindra CEO’s AI startup partners with Indosat
items.author: CP Gurnani, Rahul Bhatia
items.summary:
- AIonOS, founded by ex-Tech Mahindra CEO CP Gurnani, partners with Indosat for AI solutions in tourism, agriculture, and education.
- The initiative is part of a government-to-government plan between India and Indonesia to boost digital transformation in Southeast Asia.
- AIonOS will set up a Centre of Excellence in Jakarta with Chinese firm DeepSeek, leveraging open-source large language models (LLMs).
- Gurnani assured that AIonOS adheres to regulations while collaborating with different global AI companies.
- The partnership aims to enhance workforce skills and agricultural productivity in Indonesia.
- AIonOS, co-founded by Gurnani and InterGlobe’s Rahul Bhatia, aims to capitalize on India’s anticipated US$17 billion GenAI market by 2030.

items.title: Barcelona-based travel management platform secures $200m
items.summary:
- Barcelona-based travel management platform TravelPerk raised US$200 million in a series E funding round, valuing the company at US$2.7 billion.
- The funding round was led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Growth and others, totaling US$860 million raised since 2015.
- TravelPerk acquired Swiss AI-driven spend management firm Yokoy for an undisclosed amount.
- With global business travel spending expected to exceed US$1.5 trillion in 2024, TravelPerk aims to enhance its offerings and expand its presence in the US.
- The funding and acquisition aim to position TravelPerk as a leader in travel and expense management solutions.

items.title: Paytm Payments CEO to step down in March
items.author: Nakul Jain
items.summary:
- Nakul Jain, managing director and CEO of Paytm Payments Services Limited, will resign on March 31, 2025.
- Jain has led PPSL for nearly three years and has 25 years of banking experience, including roles at Standard Chartered Bank.
- Paytm is actively seeking a successor and plans to announce the appointment soon.
- Jain’s departure is part of a broader trend of leadership changes at Paytm and its subsidiaries over the past year.

items.title: India-based fintech raises $16.22m for alternative fund
items.summary:
- Veloce Fintech, a subsidiary of Lemon Group, raised 140 crore rupees (US$16.22 million) for its Veloce Opportunities Fund.
- The fund has deployed 100 crore rupees (US$11.55 million) so far, including 40 crore rupees (US$4.6 million) via a greenshoe option.
- It aims for a total corpus of 200 crore rupees (US$23.14 million) by March.
- Investments range from 1 crore rupees (US$115,519) to 20 crore rupees (US$2.3 million).
- The fund targets HNIs and NRIs with projected returns of 18%, focusing on governance and scalability.

items.title: Zepto relocates HQ to India ahead of anticipated IPO
items.summary:
- Zepto has relocated its headquarters from Singapore to India as Indian startups return home.
- The move comes as Zepto prepares for an anticipated IPO later this year, aiming to raise up to $1.1 billion.
- Regulatory changes in India facilitate such relocations, with Zepto's valuation at $5 billion and significant fundraising achieved last year.
- This trend reflects a growing momentum in the Indian IPO market, attracting companies previously registered abroad back to India.

items.title: Oyo-backed coworking space raises $12.7m for expansion
items.summary:
- Innov8, a coworking space provider backed by OYO, raised 110 crore rupees (approximately US$12.7 million) in its latest funding round.
- The funding, facilitated by InCred, involved contributions from family offices such as Mankind Pharma and Gauri Khan, valuing Innov8 at 1,000 crore rupees (around US$115 million).
- Innov8 diluted 10% of its stake, and the funding round was oversubscribed by 2.7 times.
- The raised capital will be used for acquisitions, technology improvements, partnerships, and expansion into niche markets.
- Founded in 2015, Innov8 operates premium coworking spaces across cities including Delhi NCR, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Bangalore, and Hyderabad.

items.title: Indian fintech marketplace secures $7m pre-series A
items.summary:
- Ambak, a fintech marketplace for home finance in Gurugram, raised US$7 million in funding.
- The funding round included seed and pre-series A investments, led by Peak XV’s Surge.
- Ambak plans to expand operations to 35 cities and aims to serve over 100,000 customers by the financial year 2026.
- The company projects loan disbursements exceeding US$1 billion by 2026 and will invest in vernacular AI for customer service.
- This funding occurs amid a 19% decline in India's fintech funding in 2024, down from US$3.1 billion to US$2.5 billion.

items.title: European software firm reports AI-driven cloud revenue growth
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- SAP SE reported €4.71 billion in fourth-quarter cloud revenue, a 27% increase from the previous year.
- The growth is attributed to AI-enhanced cloud offerings as businesses shift to cloud infrastructure.
- SAP raised its 2025 cloud revenue forecast to €21.6–€21.9 billion and noted a 29% increase in cloud backlog to €18.1 billion.
- CEO Christian Klein highlighted that half of cloud orders now include AI features.
- SAP shares increased by 61% last year, making it Europe's most valuable tech company ahead of ASML Holding NV.

items.title: VCs view DeepSeek’s AI model as catalyst for US startups
items.summary:
- Venture capitalists invested over US$300 billion in US AI startups in the last five years.
- DeepSeek's new AI model raises concerns but is viewed positively by US VCs as a motivator for faster AI adoption.
- Investors like Garry Tan from Y Combinator believe the model will lower AI computing costs, benefiting startups.
- There are expectations for global AI researchers to replicate DeepSeek’s advancements, pushing the industry forward.
- The success of DeepSeek highlights the need for US companies to adapt, with some referring to it as the 'Sputnik moment' for AI.

items.title: Indian lending tech startup secures $4.22m series A
India’s ShareChat opens Southeast Asia AI hub in Singapore
items.summary:
- India’s ShareChat has launched its first Southeast Asia AI Centre of Excellence in Singapore.
- This is ShareChat's third international facility, following its locations in the US and UK.
- The center will enhance AI models for personalized content, ad targeting, and user-generated content authenticity.
- ShareChat plans to build a 30-member team in Singapore over the next three years, using local AI talent and infrastructure.
- The initiative is led by CTO Nitin Jain, who previously worked with TikTok and Gojek.
- ShareChat aims to collaborate with local Singaporean agencies and institutions to develop AI talent and facilitate global knowledge exchange.

items.title: Unilever Indonesia on shaky ground
items.summary:
- Unilever Indonesia's financial difficulties have led to selling its ice cream business for about US$440 million in November 2024.
- The sale reduces the food and refreshment category’s revenue contribution from 35% to 28%.
- Boycotts linked to the Israel-Palestine conflict and competition are affecting sales in Indonesia, which makes up nearly 4% of Unilever’s global sales.
- Homegrown competitors like Wings Group and Mayora are gaining market share in Indonesia as Unilever struggles.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Southeast Asia’s startups
items.summary:
- A list of the most active investors in Southeast Asia's startups has been generated, categorized by the number of deals over the past two years.
- The focus is on firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this time frame.
- The data is ongoing and invites contributions for accuracy from funds via research@techinasia.com.
